intro: Adenosma buchneroides, commonly known as the narrowleaf adenosma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as capsules. Adenosma buchneroides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
